Class MarsProcessor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.lang.Thread
        |
        +--MarsProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Processor, java.lang.Runnable, TimerUser
public class MarsProcessor
extends java.lang.Thread
implements Processor, TimerUser

This class contains the implementation of the simulated MARS processor.

Method Detail

setInterruptHandler

public void setInterruptHandler(int irqn,
                                InterruptHandler handler)
This method registers an interrupt handler for the specified interrupt number. Once registered, the specific interrupt handler will be invoked whenever the interrupt is generated. The semantic of this invocation is similar to that of the POSIX system call signal; clearly, while signal is a system call (and thus is done at the operating system level, setInterruptHandler is done at the (simulated) hardware level.

Specified by:
setInterruptHandler in interface Processor
Parameters:
irqn - the interrupt number identifying the interrupt type handled by the specified handler.

tick

public void tick()
This method is invoked whenever a timer tick expires. Note that opportune synchronization mechanisms are missing. You may have to modify this class to enforce synchronization between timers, dma and memory.

Specified by:
tick in interface TimerUser
